description: Latin absistere, present active infinitive of absistō (“desist”); from ab (“from, away from”) + sistō (“stand”).

verbs.description: absist (third-person singular simple present absists, present participle absisting, simple past and past participle absisted)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To stand apart from; to leave off; to desist.
examples: They promise to absist from their purpose of making a war.
